geninfo.para: 2000, 4000 and 8000 Model vehicles built from December 5, 1994, through July 21, 1995, may have intermittent Air Conditioning system operation between temperatures of 70 to 80 degrees F., and have an operational A/C system when the vehicle is brought into the service center. Under these low temperature conditions, the low side pressure may momentarily fall below the A/C low pressure switch setting thereby disengaging the A/C compressor clutch. This automatically latches or holds the A/C relay in the open position until the operator turns the ignition key off and on, or until the A/C control switch is cycled. This condition does not exist on all vehicles. If a customer encounters this condition, perform the following procedure to correct it.
All vehicles built after July 21, 1995, will not exhibit this condition and will not require this repair.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Refer to TSI-95-16-02 for information to service components in the Heater-A/C system on the above listed vehicles built after December 4, 1994.

step1.para: Remove the lower right instrument panel cover ( Figure 1).
Remove the lower relay panel mounting screws from the instrument panel ( Figure 2).
Remove the air conditioning relay from the electrical harness plug.
Remove the screw that fastens the relay harness plug to the relay panel.
Use a plug lock tool to remove the electrical harness plug lock tab. Pull the lock out from the electrical harness plug.
Locate wire number 77L, which will be in plug position no. 4. Use tool to unlock terminal tab and pull wire no. 77L and terminal out of the relay plug ( Figure 3).
Use electrical tape and tape wire 77L terminal that was removed from the harness plug. Bend the wire back 180 degrees onto the harness and tape the wire to the harness assembly.
Install relay electrical harness plug on relay panel.
Install relay in electrical harness plug.
Install relay panel assembly on instrument panel ( Figure 2).
Install lower right side instrument panel cover ( Figure 1).
Operate A/C system to confirm system operates properly.
